statement:
Let \(J\) be the \(n \times n\) matrix all of whose entries are 1 .\\
(i) Determine \(\chi_{J}\) and show that there are two eigenvalues, 0 and \(n\).\\
(ii) Find the corresponding eigenspaces. Is \(J\) diagonalizable?

parts.label: i
parts.statement: Determine \(\chi_{J}\) and show that there are two eigenvalues, 0 and \(n\).\\

parts.label: ii
parts.statement: Find the corresponding eigenspaces. Is \(J\) diagonalizable?
